Boris Barja González

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/6258419854905367
  • Última atualização do currículo em 19/10/2018

Possui doutorado em Ciencias Meteorológicas pelo Instituto de Meteorología de Cuba (2010). Tem experiência na área de Geociências, com ênfase em Meteorologia (Ciências Atmosféricas). Tem interesse no estudo de nuvens cirrus, aerossóis e vapor de água, utilizando instrumentos em solo e satélite. Tem interesse em transferência radiativa atmosferica e o efeito dos constituintes atmosféricos na radiação. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Vínculo institucional

2004 - 2011
Vínculo: , Enquadramento Funcional: Investigador Agregado, Regime: Dedicação exclusiva.
Outras informações
Eu trabalho na caracterização das nuvens cirrus na região do Grande Caribe, com instrumento SAGE II. Também em a caracterização de nuvens cirrus em Camagüey .Eu terminei a caracterização dos cirros medidos com Lidar, em Região Camagüey . Também concluo a assimilação e adaptação às condições locais do código de transferência radiativa .Eu trabalho também no estudo da influência das nuvens cirrus sobre a radiação solar em nossa região. No ano de 2008 , iniciei a minha participação no projeto para a caracterização dos aerossóis sobre a região de Camagüey , em colaboração com o Grupo de Óptica Atmosférica ( GOA ) da Universidade de Valladolid, Espanha. Usamos medições sunphotometricas e de distribuição de tamanho de partícula por gravimetria para o estudo das propriedades ópticas dos aerossóis. Eu recebi treinamento na instalação do instrumento Dekati PM10e CIMEL CE- 318 sunphotometer . Durante ano 2009-2011 , continuei meu trabalho no projeto relacionado com a caracterização dos aerossóis sobre Camagüey . Além disso, iniciei a minha participação como um investigador principal no projeto de pesquisa em colaboração com GOA . O tema deste projeto é a caracterização das nuvens e seu impacto sobre a radiação atmosférica sobre a região de Camagüey . Durante um mês, em 2009, eu fiz um estágio de pesquisa no GOA e do Departamento de Física da Universidade da Beira Interior , Portugal. Nesse período , eu completei algumas experiências no tratamento de dados de concentração de material particulado ( PM), composição química , e coeficiente de absorção PM . Completei algumas tarefas de treinamento na simulação numérica da transferência de radiação na atmosfera. E uma discussão de planejamento sobre medição nuvem usando CIMEL CE- 318 sunphotometer. A tese de doutorado foi apresentado no ano de 2010 .

Projetos de pesquisa
2018 - Atual
Monitoreo y Caracterización de los componentes químicos de los aerosoles atmosféricos medidos en superficie en Punta Arenas
Descrição: Este proyecto busca realizar el monitoreo y la caracterización química de los aerosoles medidos en superficie con un recolector de partículas atmosféricas en filtro..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Mestrado acadêmico: (1) .

Integrantes: Boris Barja González - Coordenador / Henrique Barbosa - Integrante / Felix Zamorano - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Universidad de Magallanes - Auxílio financeiro.
2017 - Atual
Dynamics, Aerosol, Cloud and Precipitation Observations in the Pristine Environment of the Southern Ocean (DACAPO-PESO)
Descrição: The project DACAPO-PESO is motivated by need to provide an explanation for the observed evidence of strong regional contrasts in heterogeneous ice formation efficiency. Various studies report that heterogeneous ice formation in the temperature range between -40 and 0°C is more efficient in the northern hemisphere than in the southern hemisphere. This conclusion was also supported by lidar observations of stratiform clouds in the northern midlatitudes (Leipzig, Germany, 51°C) and the southern midlatitudes (Punta Arenas, Chile, 53.1° S) which were conducted by Leibniz Institute for Tropospheric Research (TROPOS), Leipzig, Germany. Meanwhile, the mobile ground-based supersite LACROS of TROPOS is operated to provide observations with co-located lidar, cloud radar, precipitation-profiling radar, Doppler lidar, microwave radiometer, sun photometer, precipitation disdrometer, a radiation balance station, an all-sky cloud camera and irregular launches of radiosondes. These observations allow to derive aerosol-cloud-dynamics-precipitation interaction in much higher detail than with lidar alone. In Europe LACROS has collected multi-year datasets of these observations for the continental site of Leipzig and the strongly mineral-dust-burden subtropical region of Cyprus. In a next step, LACROS will be deployed in Punta Arenas, Chile, which is the southernmost point of continental land mass of the southern hemisphere showing a mitlatidudinal to subpolar climate. Contrasting the LACROS observations from Leipzig, Cyprus, and Punta Arenas, which are based on the same instrumentation, will allow to infer the reasons for the regional observed differences in heterogeneous ice formation efficiency..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Mestrado acadêmico: (2) Doutorado: (2) .

Integrantes: Boris Barja González - Integrante / SEIFERT, PATRIC - Integrante / Albert Ansmann - Coordenador / Johannes Bühl - Integrante / Martin Radenz - Integrante / Teresa Vogl - Integrante / Heike Kalesse - Integrante / Willi Schimmel - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Leibniz-Institut für Troposphärenforschung - Auxílio financeiro.
2013 - 2018
SAVERNet. South American Environment Risk Network
Descrição: SAVER-Net Project is a management system on atmospheric environmental risks through the monitoring of the state of aerosol , ozone layer and UV radiation measured on the observation sites and almost at real time and made available from the Centro de Investigaciones de Láseres y Aplicaciones (CEILAP) (Center of Laser Research and Applications)and Laboratorio de Investigaciones Atmosféricas de la Universidad de Magallanes ( Laboratory of Atmospheric Investigations of the Magallanes University) to relevant ministries and agencies. Higher Objective The relevant ministries and agencies can make use of the management system on atmospheric environmental risks to minimize those risks and the damage to society such as those from ultraviolet radiation, aerosol use and so on. The relevant ministries and agencies can for example be the ministries related to Health, Environment or Agriculture. Other relevant organisms such as the National Meteorological Service, the National Agency of Civil Aviation and all other Agencies related to air navigation Expected results An aerosol monitoring net with a near to real time answer will be developed. The principal properties of aerosols focused on the areas of origin, type of aerosols, transport and seasonal variations are estimated. The present observation systems of the ozone layer and UV radiation (millimeter- wave radiometer equipment, ozone LIDAR and associated instruments) will be updated. The variations of the ozone layer hole and the process of mixture- dilution of in the ozone depleted air due to the ozone hole at median latitudes of the south American region are analyzed. An integrated analysing system of atmospheric environmental risks will be developed. A system that has as an objective the exchange of the data analyzed during the development of the Project with the relevant ministries and agencies will be developed and evaluated..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Boris Barja González - Integrante / Eduardo Quel - Integrante / PAWELKO, E. - Integrante / RISTORI, P. - Integrante / OTERO, LIDIA - Integrante / Felix Zamorano - Integrante / Elian Wolfram - Integrante / Nobuo Sugimoto - Integrante / Jin Yoshitaka - Integrante / Akira Mizuno - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Japan International Cooperation Agency - Auxílio financeiro.
2013 - 2016
The Future of Climate Extremes in the Caribbean (XCUBE)
Descrição: The North Atlantic basin, including the Caribbean Sea and the Gulf of Mexico, exhibits substantial interannual to interdecadal variability of tropical cyclone activity. Major hurricanes are the most extreme type of Atlantic cyclones, and have major impacts on humans and society in the surrounding regions. Increases in key measures of Atlantic hurricane activity over recent decades are believed to reflect to a large degree increases in tropical Atlantic warming (e.g., Emmanuel, 2005). During recent decades a lot of attention has been paid to the apparent observed multidecadal pattern in Atlantic sea surface temperature (SST), often referred to as Atlantic Multidecadal Variability (AMV). The oceans are the primary energy source for tropical cyclones, so understanding long-term changes in Atlantic SSTs could therefore potentially be of prime importance for understanding long-term hurricane variability. Some recent studies (e.g., Goldenberg et al. 2001; Zang and Delworth 2006) have in fact attributed recent increases in hurricane activity to natural climate variations associated to AMV, while others suggest that human-induced climate change are more important (Emmanuel 2005; Webster et al 2005). However, resolving this issue will require a much improved understanding of the governing mechanisms for long-term changes in Atlantic SSTs that are still missing. To what extent the AMO is driven by internal variations in the large-scale ocean circulation (Delworth and Mann 2000; Knight et al. 2005; Jungclaus et al. 2006) or external climate forcings such as volcanoes (e.g., Otterå et al. 2010) or anthropogenic factors (e.g., Mann and Emmanuel 2006) is still largely uncertain. Atlantic SST has further been linked to long-term variations in both Sahel and North Brazilian rainfall (e.g., Knight et al. 2006) as well as Indian monsoon changes (Luo et al. 2011). A better understanding of long-term (multidecadal) variations in Atlantic SSTs are therefore urgently needed. The XCUBE project?s goals are to better understand future changes in the Caribbean climate, with a special focus on hurricanes and drought; to provide training to researchers at INSMET, the Meteorological Institute in Cuba; and to improve the infrastructure at INSMET.
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (1) / Especialização: (1) / Mestrado acadêmico: (2) .

Integrantes: Boris Barja González - Integrante / René Estevan - Integrante / Juan Carlos Antuña Jr. - Integrante / Jorge Rosas - Integrante / ANTUÑA, JUAN CARLOS - Integrante / Frank Garcia - Integrante / Allan Robock - Integrante / Dr. Odd Helge Otterå - Coordenador / Dr. Maritza Ballester - Integrante / Nelson Diaz - Integrante / Michel Mesquita - Integrante.
2013 - 2016
Cloud optical properties in the Amazon derived from ground and satellite based instruments
Descrição: This research proposal focuses on the determination of cirrus cloud optical properties in the Amazon region from different ground and satellite based instruments before and during GoAmazon/CHUVA Experiments. Understanding the behavior of the optical characteristics of clouds and their lifecycle will allow us to evaluate their interaction with solar and terrestrial radiation. A second objective of this proposal will be the evaluation of the cloud radiative effects. Cloud optical depths (COD) will be evaluated from the LIDAR and radiometer instruments, both installed in experimental sites upwind and downwind from Manaus city. Results will be compared with those obtained from satellite instruments. An evaluation of the cloud radiative forcing on the solar radiation will also be obtained by two different methods in the different sites of measurements: modeling and direct solar radiation measurements. These activities will be involved directly with the Green Ocean Amazon (GoAmazon) 2014/2015 experiment from ARM. This research on optical and radiative properties of cirrus clouds should allow, in the future, improving the representation of clouds in the atmospheric models, what is direct related to FAPESP Thematic project ?CHUVA - Cloud processes of tHe main precipitation systems in Brazil: A contribUtion to cloud resolVing modeling and to the GPM (GlobAl Precipitation Measurement)?. PhD. Boris Barja González is a researcher in the Atmospheric Optics Group of Camagüey, Meteorological Institute, Cuba. He has long experience in these proposed topics..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (3) / Mestrado acadêmico: (1) / Doutorado: (1) .

2013 - 2015
Caracterización del contenido integral del vapor de agua atmosférico sobre la región oriental de Cuba.
Descrição: El presente proyecto busca caracterizar el comportamiento del contenido integral del vapor de agua sobre Cuba. Evaluar el contenido integral de vapor de agua a partir de diferentes instrumentos: GPS en superficie y satélite, fotómetro solar, y datos del reanálisis en los diferentes sitios de medición. Realizar una comparación entre el valor de contenido integral de vapor de agua obtenido con los diferentes instrumentos en los diferentes sitios. Instalar en Camagüey instrumento GPS para la medición de contenido integral de vapor de agua. Evaluar relación entre los valores de contenido integral de vapor de agua y los valores de humedad en superficie para diferentes puntos seleccionados en la Región Oriental de Cuba. Realizar una caracterización del contenido integral de vapor de agua a partir de los datos de GPS de satélite y reanálisis para la región oriental del país. Evaluar el comportamiento del contenido integral del vapor de agua en la Región Oriental del país, a partir del análisis conjunto de los resultados obtenidos. Resultados esperados: Evaluación del Contenido Integral de Vapor de agua en diferentes puntos de la Región Oriental de Cuba a partir de diferentes instrumentos de medición. Caracterización del comportamiento del contenido integral del vapor de agua sobre la Región Oriental de Cuba. Se prevé 2 Informes Científico Técnico relacionados con los 2 resultados. 2 Artículos Científico relacionado con los resultados..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

2013 - 2015
Caracterización del Espesor Óptico por Aerosoles en Camagüey con mediciones de banda ancha y fotómetro solar. Implementación del Servicio de Información de EOA para Cuba.
Descrição: El presente proyecto persigue como objetivo general la Implementación del servicio en tiempo real (cada una hora) de información de Espesor Óptico por Aerosoles a partir de mediciones de radiación solar de banda ancha realizadas por las estaciones actinométricas existentes en el país. 2012 - 2013
Propriedades ópticas de nuvens na Amazônia a partir de medidas com lidar e radiômetro
Descrição: This research proposal focuses on the determination of cloud optical properties in the Amazon region from different ground and satellite based instruments. Understanding the behavior of the optical characteristics of clouds will allow us to evaluate their interaction with solar radiation. Hence a secondary objective of this proposal will be the preliminary evaluation of the cloud radiative effects. Cloud optical depths (COD) will be evaluated from the LIDAR and MFRSR instruments, both installed in an experimental site near Manaus, and results will be compared with those obtained from satellite instruments. An initial evaluation of the cloud radiative forcing on the solar radiation will also be obtained by two different methods: modeling and direct solar radiation measurements. These activities will contribute directly to the FAPESP Thematic project ?AEROCLIMA - Direct and indirect effects of aerosols on climate in Amazonia and Pantanal?. This research on optical and radiative properties of clouds should allow, in the future, improving the representation of clouds in the atmospheric models, what is direct related to FAPESP Thematic project ?CHUVA - Cloud processes of tHe main precipitation systems in Brazil: A contribUtion to cloud resolVing modeling and to the GPM (GlobAl Precipitation Measurement)?. PhD. Boris Barja González is a researcher in the Atmospheric Optics Group of Camagüey, Meteorological Institute, Cuba. He has long experience in these proposed topics..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Mestrado acadêmico: (1) .

Integrantes: Boris Barja González - Integrante / Henrique Barbosa - Coordenador / Diego Gouveia - Integrante.

2009 - 2012
Caracterización del efecto de las nubes sobre la radiación solar en la región de Camagüey
Descrição: En laejecución de este proyectofueron logrados los siguientes objetivos: ? Evaluar algoritmo para la limpieza de nubes en las mediciones de espesores ópticos por aerosoles del fotómetro solar, utilizado en AERONET. ? Caracterizar el comportamiento de la radiación solar en presencia de diferentes tipos de nubes, empleando la base de datos de radiación solar de banda ancha (actinometría), datos de radiación solar espectrales (fotómetro). ? Parametrizar las propiedades de las nubes para su utilización en cálculos de simulación numérica de transferencia radiativa. ? Asimilar un modelo de transferencia radiativa con alta resolución [Cachorro et al., 2000]. ? Validar los resultados de la modelación numérica de transferencia radiativa con los resultados medidos. ? Determinar las magnitudes del forzamiento radiativo de las nubes en la región de Camagüey..

2007 - 2009
Caracterización del impacto radiativo de los aerosoles troposféricos en Camagüey y las zonas más próximas de las regiones central y oriental de Cuba.
Descrição: Caracterizar el impacto radiativo sobre el clima y el estado del tiempo de los aerosoles troposféricos en general y de las nubes de polvo del Sahara, en particular para Camagüey y las zonas más próximas de las regiones central y oriental de Cuba. Establecer una serie de días tipo de cielo despejado a lo largo del año, que puedan emplearse para la validación, calibración y ajuste de modelos numéricos y observaciones satelitales. Determinar, a partir de la serie de observaciones de radiación solar, si se ha producido en Camagüey y las zonas más próximas de las regiones central y oriental de Cuba, el apantallamiento de la radiación solar (solar dimming) en el período 1960-1990 que se ha registrado en otras regiones del planeta, y en caso positivo, evaluar su magnitud y posible causa. Determinar la magnitud del impacto radiativo de las nubes de polvo del Sahara que alcanzan Camagüey y las zonas más próximas de las regiones central y oriental de Cuba..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Medición simultánea de aerosoles troposféricos y estratosféricos en Cuba y Argentina?
Descrição: In this project we develop acolaboration in the study of the stratospheric aerosols in Argentina,and tropospheric aerosols in Camagüey with lidar in both locations. Also, we test some of the algorithms to obtain cirrus clouds characteristics with data from both lidar..

2004 - 2006
Recuperación de la Base de Datos de Radiación Solar de la Estación Camaguey.
Descrição: La estación meteorológica de Camagüey cuenta con más de 30 años de observaciones actinométricas. Estas observaciones se hayan en papel y han sido procesadas manualmente. Existen algunas bases de datos de los resultados de estas observaciones, pero ninguna parte de la base de datos original y/o cubre todo el periodo de observaciones disponible. Además las Tablas KM-12 y TM- 12 que contienen la observación original y los resultados del procesamiento manual, respectivamente, ya muestran alarmantes signos de deterioro. El presente proyecto está destinado a recuperar la base de datos de mediciones actinométricas, creándola en soporte computacional y someterla a procesamiento y control de la calidad automatizado. Con este fin se recuperó una PC-386 dada de baja por rotura y se utilizará además una de las microcomputadoras de la Estación Lidar. La base de datos que se producirá cumplirá con los estándares internacionales para este tipo de información. Para este fin se combinara la experticidad y experiencia del personal de la Red de Estaciones y de la Estación Lidar. La ejecución de este proyecto permitirá ganar experiencia para acometer en un futuro la recuperación del archivo de datos del Centro Meteorológico Provincial (CMC). Como objetivo general del proyecto se persigue la creación de una base de datos computarizada de radiación solar que cumpla con los estándares internacionales. Crear una base de datos de observaciones actinométricas. Establecer la adición regular a dicha B/D de las nuevas observaciones que realicen. Elaborar y poner en explotación un software de cálculo de la radiación solar y control de la calidad de las observaciones. Adquirir experiencia en la recuperación de datos meteorológicos que permita acometer el rescate del archivo del CMC..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Especialização: (1) / Mestrado acadêmico: (1) Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Boris Barja González - Integrante / René Estevan - Integrante / Teresita Hernández - Integrante / Carlos Hernández - Integrante / Aramís Fonte - Integrante / Antuña, J. C. - Coordenador / Roberto Acea - Integrante.
2003 - 2005
Caracterización de las Nubes Cirros sobre Camagüey
Descrição: This Project was related to climatology of the presence of cirrus clouds over the region of Camagüey in Cuba, which has been constructed from the analysis of three-hourly reports contained in the observations of six ground meteorological stations. The data was taken from 1971 to 2002; only in one station the data starts from 1976. The cirrus clouds occurrence values have been found higher in the named rainy period, there are values between 0.50 and 0.70. The diurnal cycle in the occurrence of cirrus clouds wasn?t analyzed, due there are a difficulty of the treatment of the night observations linked with the visibility reduction and the scarce of night observations. Also an analysis of the cirrus clouds subtypes reported was made. A subtype of cirrus clouds (cirrus spissatus) is the most predominant in all period at the half of time when the cirrus clouds are present, with frequency of occurrence values between 0.57 y 0.61. In the present project also the atmospheric extinction profiles from the SAGE II sensor onboard the Earth Radiation Budget Satellite (ERBS) have been used to analize the occurrence frequency and the optical and geometrical depth of the optically thin cirrus clouds over the Wider Caribbean region. The extinction ratio between the two wavelengths at 0.525 and 1.02 μm was used to separate the profiles containing only aerosols from thus containing a cloud/aerosols mixture (Kent and McCormick, 1991). This ratio shows a different behavior in the interaction between solar radiation crystal ice and aerosols at both wavelengths. The SAGE II dataset version 6.2 was used, extending 21 years, from October 1984 to August 2005. The results show a seasonal behavior in the cirrus clouds occurrence frequency; with a maximum of 35.5 and 17.2% in the rainy and little rainy periods, respectively. These peaks of cirrus clouds frequencies are located at 14.5 and 12.0 km of altitude. An occurrence of 9% was obtained above the tropopause level. About 75% of the.
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Mestrado acadêmico: (1) Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Boris Barja González - Coordenador / René Estevan - Integrante / Antuña, J. C. - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Regional Representative of the Cuban Environmental Ministry - Auxílio financeiro.

2000 - 2001
Characterization of the stratospheric and upper tropospheric aerosols over Central and Sud-America
Descrição: The present proposal addresses issues as determination of the spatio-temporal features of the lower stratospheric and upper tropospheric aerosols over Central and South America. Both satellite and lidar data will be used to achieve this goal. Two main periods will be subject of the study: the one with no volcanic perturbation (stratosphere aerosol background condition) and the post-volcanic periods. Particular attention will be dedicated to determine the temporal evolution of the aerosol extinction 3-D characteristics. It will be used for a preliminary evaluation of the STE considering the aerosols as tracers for the cross tropopause transport. Trajectory analysis will also be also to determine the geographic location of the potential aerosol sources as well as to complement the transport analysis aforementioned. Satellite data will consist of the SAGE II instrument dataset, the longest available global record of vertical aerosol profiles at various wavelengths. Aerosol backscattering profiles from the lidar stations located at Sao Jose dos Campos (Brazil) and Camagüey (Cuba) will be used as complimentary information. The upgrade of the current capabilities of the Camagüey lidar station is proposed, to maintain the ongoing middle atmosphere aerosol measurements. The present and future dataset resulting from the measurements made by this lidar project have played and will be playing an important role in current and future international research projects. We also plan to conduct the workshop "Lidar measurements in the Americas". It will promote the initial agreements as well as coordinate the joint effort necessary for the future establishment of a lidar network in the Americas. Such network will be based on the existing lidar projects, promoting its development through cooperation and interchange. Such a network will also help increase the number of LIDAR systems operating in the region..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Doutorado: (1) .

Integrantes: Boris Barja González - Integrante / Mario Lavorato - Integrante / Pablo Canziani - Integrante / René Estevan - Integrante / Antuña, J. C. - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Instituto Interamericano para Pesquisas em Mudanças Globais - Auxílio financeiro.
Número de produções C, T & A: 4
